intro: Polygala perrieri, commonly known as the Perrier's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, with a distinctive spurred structure that aids in pollination. Polygala perrieri is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
